amendment.description: To make available from amounts available for the Federal Highway Administration for the Transportation and Community and System Pilot Preservation Program, $850,000 for interior air quality demonstration activities at the Bristol, Virginia, control facility to evaluate standard industrial fuel system performance and efficiency with drive-by-wire engine management and emissions systems.

vote.text: Amendment SA 1959 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

action.text: Amendment SA 1959 proposed by Senator Shelby for Senator Warner. (consideration: CR S13121-13122; text: CR S13121-13122) To make available from amounts available for the Federal Highway Administration for the Transportation and Community and System Pilot Preservation Program, $850,000 for interior air quality demonstration activities at the Bristol, Virginia, control facility to evaluate standard industrial fuel system performance and efficiency with drive-by-wire engine management and emissions systems.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 1959 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 1959 proposed by Senator Shelby for Senator Warner.
